{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30109].
  {panel}

When you include a page that contains tables inside another page everything inside the tables is resized.

1) Create a page with table data
a) I specifically noticed this when this original page was using a section macro that contained two colum macors both containing tables with multiple headers
2) Save the page
3) Create another page
4) Use the include page macro to include your original page
5) Notice how your table content is now huge
fields.summary: Including a page with tables inside another page causes sizing error

fields.description: Using the OS X 10.8.3 Mail.app client, the email notifications in 5.2-beta1 are broken as they relate to file attachments. To reproduce, I went to an existing page, went into the editor, clicked "+" -> Attachment, and used the Browse link to upload a local file. After the upload completed, the email was delivered to my inbox looking as shown in the attachment. The email source is also attached as emailbody.txt. Specific issues: 1- There is a big "Missing plug-in" square in the middle of the screen. It looks like it's coming from this: {code}{code} (There appears to be no corresponding "attachment-icon" image in the mail.) 2- The RHS margin of the email body is clipped. Notice how the "Manage notification" is flush right with the window border (no matter how large I make the window), and that there is shaded gray LHS margin but no RHS margin.
fields.summary: Broken layout for email attachment notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30103].
  {panel}

When the 'Page Properties Report' macro is displaying information from one 'Page Properties' macro, its columns should follow the order of the columns/lines of the table on the 'Page Properties' macro that it is displaying, instead of sorting them alphabetically as it is now.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
* Add the 'Page Properties' macro on a page with a table within it and populate the table.
* On another page add the 'Page Properties Report' macro to display the content of the page created on the step above.

h3. Workaround
As a workaround you can use the *Columns to Show* advanced option to dictate the order:
# Edit your Page Properties Report macro
# Go to Options
# List your properties in the desired order in the *Columns to show* field
# Confluence will now display them in the desired order
fields.summary: Columns on the 'Page Properties Report' macro should follow the order of the labeled 'Page Properties' macro that is being displayed

fields.description:
After upgrading to Confluence 5.1 the template are not working anymore since they were defined as wiki markup. They only display the following:
bq. Unknown macro: 'unmigrated-wiki-content'

I have been running the Content Migration function, but to no effect.

Since the wiki code was available in version control I have tried the Wiki Markup macro, but that doesn'tn work either in the template editor. I get this message:
{quote}
Wiki Markup Conversion Errors
error : Bad Request
{quote}

The Wiki Marco macro does work in a normal page editor, so the current work around is to import the wiki markup in an ordinary page, and the copy-paste it to the template editor.
fields.summary: Template editor does not parse wiki markup.

fields.description:
What should happen:
{code}
Given I have clicked on 'create' 
and I have selected 'Blog post' as the content type to create
When I switch space selections
Then my content type ('Blog post') should still be selected.
{code}

What currently happens:
{code}
Given I have clicked on 'create' 
And I have selected 'Blog post' as the content type to create
When I switch space selections
Then my content type is not selected And confluence has reset to 'Blank page'
{code}

Currently when a user switches spaces their content type selection is ignored and confluence reset to 'Blank page'. This should not happen and my content type selection should persist if it is available in new space!
fields.summary: A user's 'type' of content should not be changed upon switching the space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30093].
  {panel}

Hi,

there was a post on your documentation page on Content By User Macro to improve it with additional parameters:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Content+by+User+Macro

This would be a real improvement to the system, being allowed to automatically list and extract content by user and by spaces

some more parameter would be nice – for example

*limit:pages|blogs|comments
*spaces:1|2|3
*max-count:0..999 etc.

The Content-by-label Macro is very close to it, but you need labels on the page for it to work, which is not always the case. It forces us to ask the users to put their name on the label field - not very userfriendly & reliable...

If you know an existing macro doing this, let me know,

Kind regards
fields.summary: Confluence by User improvement

fields.description:
When creating a bullet, numbered, or task list after a line that is formatted with bold, italic, underline, color, or any of the more formatting options, the bullet is displayed and then the cursor goes to the subsequent line. It's not possible to place the cursor next to the bullet and enter text. If the page is saved, the stray bullet show in the editor is not displayed. I think what is happening is that the editor creates invalid HTML by trying to put a formatting tag (such as if an underline) around the list tags (
  • ...
). For instance the editor tries to do
  • ...
. A way to handle this problem while editing is to click on the stray bullet and clear any formatting settings. Alternatively, you can avoid it by enter a blank space or some text before clicking the Bullet List button. However, users are not typically going to know intuitively how to get around this problem. We consider this a major issue because of the frustration it causes most of our users.
fields.summary: Creation of invalid bullet list in Confluence editor

fields.description:
Possibly related to CONF-30084:

I set up a new Confluence 5.2 system and installed a plugin which contains a PluginUpgradeTask defined in the [manner suggested by Atlassian|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Writing+a+Plugin+Upgrade+Task+to+Migrate+User+Data+to+New+User+Keys].

Next, I went to Admin->Backup & Restore and told it to restore a previously-saved XML backup of a Confluence 5.1 system.

The restore seems to complete successfully, but the PluginUpgradeTask in my plugin is never run. The plugin is fully operational, except my persisted username data is never migrated to user keys, which poses a big problem.

If I then go to the UPM and upload the plugin again, the PluginUpgradeTask does run successfully. (If I shut down and restart the system, I get hit by CONF-30084 problem and the system never comes back up.)

Analogous to CONF-30084, the PluginUpgradeTask *does* get run if the upgrade is performed in other ways (such as by doing a fresh Conf 5.2 install and feeding it the 5.1.x XML during the initial setup, then installing the plugin after the restore completes). It's just the admin-section-initiated restore that seems to be having problems.
fields.summary: PluginUpgradeTasks not running when performing online restore with 5.2

fields.description:
I set up a brand new Confluence 5.1.4 site, loaded it with only the demonstration site, and then immediately performed an XML backup (attached).

I then set up a brand new, empty Confluence 5.2-beta1 site and set it up with a production database (using the "Empty Site" option, with no additional content created).

On 5.2-beta1, I then went to Admin->Backup & Restore->Restore, and told it to restore the 5.1.4 backup (using the default "Build Index" option enabled, in case it matters).

The restore seemed to work OK (see screenshot) and I was able to navigate the restored site OK.

However, after shutting down Confluence, it refused to start up again with the following error:

{code}
2013-07-24 15:31:25,962 ERROR [main] [atlassian.confluence.setup.BootstrapApplicationStartupListener] checkConfigurationOnStartup Confluence will not start up because the build number in the home directory [4381] doesn't match the build number in the database [4249].
{code}

The attached atlassian-confluence.log parallels this process:

* The initial 5.2-beta1 installation (successful) was performed at 07-24 15:24:07.
* I started the import of the 5.1.4 data at 07-24 15:30:12.
* I tried to restart Confluence again at 07-24 15:31:12 (failure).

This is obviously a simplified example, but I also saw similar problems when trying to import a 5.1 XML export to 5.2. Other upgrade procedures seem to work better: at least with the 5.1 import, if I shut down Confluence, wiped out the SQL database, and then redid the import from the setup wizard, the build number would "stick".
fields.summary: Unable to perform online restore of Confluence 5.1.4 backup to 5.2

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30079].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
* Create an issue in JIRA (e.g. FOO-1).
* Change the field configuration of that issue to set "Resolution" to "Hide" (if using the default Field Configuration, this can be done at /secure/admin/ViewIssueFields.jspa).
* Edit a page in Confluence and insert a JIRA issue macro referencing FOO-1.
* Save or Preview the page.

*Expected result:* FOO-1 should be rendered by the macro as normal.

*Actual result:* The following error is displayed:
{quote}
Error rendering macro 'jira' : com.atlassian.confluence.macro.MacroExecutionException: java.lang.NullPointerException
{quote}

Full stack trace from the logs:

{noformat}

If the Resolution field is set back to "Show", you will also need to flush Confluence's caches to get the macro working as expected (i.e. "Flush All" on /wiki/admin/cachestatistics.action). 

h5. Workaround:
Uninstall JIRA Macros Plugin v5.0 and then download v4.0.29 from [Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/confluence.extra.jira/versions] and manually upload it into Confluence from the Plugin manager (Manage Add-Ons > Upload Add-On).
fields.summary: NullPointerException when attempting to render a JIRA issue where the resolution field has been hidden

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30077].
  {panel}

The new JIRA Issue macro, accessible via Insert > JIRA Issue, does not allow the user the configure caching. Currently it's always on. The problem here is that with caching always enabled, the information shown in Confluence is not always up-to-date.

h4. Steps to reproduce
# In JIRA, create a project with a key of TEST
# Create one issue under TEST
# On the Confluence editor, use Insert > JIRA Issue, and set the JQL to "project=TEST". Save the macro and page. One issue is shown
# Create another issue under TEST
# Refresh the Confluence page. The second issue does not appear until the cache is expired, or if it's flushed manually via Confluence Admin > Cache Statistics

A workaround solution, You can remove the cache by following steps: 
# Go to the page "Confluence Admin >> Cache Statistics >> Advanced"
# Search for the term "JIRA Issues". 
# Change the value from "100" (default) to "1" 
# Click the button "Adjust Size" to enable the change. 

h4. Other issues
This is a related but separate issue from CONF-22845, which addresses the original JIRA Issues macro.
fields.summary: JIRA issue macro aggressively caches, new issues take a while to appear in the issues macro

fields.description:
Bugs in the JIRA Issues macro are preventing us from adding new releases to our changelog here https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Crucible+2.10+Changelog

* -"Insert" button does not work from Firefox- whatever was broken at the time appears fixed now
* Title, Date and Number of Issues header does not exist anymore, even when copied from an existing macro, and is not an option in the macro editor

This is a major blocker for us, as we have high profile customers who will not upgrade without the release notes.
fields.summary: JIRA issues macro: header of table "title, date..." does not exist anymore when copying an existing macro

fields.description:
The issue presents itself when a Global Template is created with the "Page Tree" and/or "Page Tree Search" macros and template variables.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a new Global Template with the offending macro(s)
# Use this global template to create a page
# Advance past the variable fill in page (you can leave the vars blank or fill them in, it makes no difference)
# You will notice that the breadcrumb bar now reads "Undefined Space" (I attempted to manually modify the location of the page with the location button at the bottom of the edit page to no effect)
# Hit Save page
# Upon saving this newly created page the "Page Not Found" error is displayed and the page is not saved
fields.summary: Page Tree and Page Tree Search macros cause Global Templates to not function properly
Add support for formatting in headers of Page Properties Report macro

fields.description:
With confluence-standalone 5.2-beta1, if I create a new install that includes the demonstration space, the user_mapping table seems to be prepopulated with the names of several internal Atlassian employees:

{code}
mysql> select * from user_mapping limit 15;
+----------------------------------+-----------+----------------+
| user_key                         | username  | lower_username |
+----------------------------------+-----------+----------------+
| 8a8f81e53ff84200013ff84c5cbe0003 | vfatia    | vfatia         |
| 8a8f81e53ff84200013ff84c5d150004 | admin     | admin          |
| 8a8f81e53ff84200013ff84c5d6d0005 | htapia    | htapia         |
| 8a8f81e53ff84200013ff84c5d9f0006 | barconati | barconati      |
| 8a8f81e53ff84200013ff84c5db50007 | jmasson   | jmasson        |
| 8a8f81e540080fd401400827cd090003 | ahab      | ahab           |
+----------------------------------+-----------+----------------+
6 rows in set (0.00 sec)
{code}

In this test instance, the two user names that were created locally were "admin" (which was set up as the admin user during the setup process) and "ahab" was created later. All of the remaining users were created automatically by the system.

I note that there are no corresponding users for these employees in cwd_user or the user browser, so the impact seems to be mostly limited to this table.

However...if I create a new user named Jack Masson (John's long-lost cousin) and give him the same userid "jmasson", Jack inherits John's original userkey, and Jack unintentionally ends up with a page watch on "Page: Learn the wonders of autoconvert (step 7 of 9)". I didn't try any of the other users.
fields.summary: Internal Atlassian employee names should not be in default user_mapping table

fields.description:
When viewing a page containing the Attachments macro with Confluence 5.2-beta1 (which is running the recently-posted Attachments plugin 3.6.7 from CONF-22002), Firefox 22 consistently consumes 50-100% of CPU.

Navigating away from the page seems to cure the problem, as does removing the attachments macro. At least one other browser (Safari) does not seem to be impacted in the same way.
fields.summary: Excessive CPU usage with Firefox when viewing page with Attachments macro
Page restriction suggestion box is ambiguous

fields.description:
I write custom gadgets for my company and they always worked well in JIRA (adding them to Dashboard). Now we need to add them to our Confluence so we added an external gadget feed and the gadgets show up in macro browser. However, after clicking Insert button, they don't appear on the page at all. If added using wiki macro, they show up, but can not be edited and block the page from saving.
Sometimes it magically works though so this may be hard to reproduce. Please try more than one time the whole process.

I created a simplistic gadget for JIRA using the command atlas-create-jira-plugin, then I changed atlassian-plugin.xml to add the gadget, and created file gadget.xml. No other changes have been made! I attached the source codes (testGadget.zip) as well as the compiled jar file (testGadget-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar).

Steps to reproduce:
1) Download the attached JAR file.
2) Install plugin in JIRA, add it to dashboard, see that it works.
3) Go to Confluence, add-ons, external gadgets and add feed from your JIRA.
4) You may need to set up trust connection between JIRA and Confluence.
5) In Confluence, create blank page, go to insert, other macros and in external content, pick our "TestGadget".
6) Try to add it.
7) Fail.

This is definitely a bug if only for the reason that it does not throw any kind of error, warning or anything else in logs or elsewhere.
fields.summary: Custom JIRA gadget can not be added to Confluence page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30059].
  {panel}

We recently rolled out a data classification policy to support federal and regulatory guidelines in the financial services industry. This requires us to clarify each document or page and report on those classifications.

We recently added this in our sharepoint instance and are looking to see if Atlassian could support this function in confluence. We were thinking something like page labels but with the following requirements:

1. at the site or space level, require all content, attachments, etc to be classified. Similar to page labels but users can't remove a classification once added.
2. Report on classifications by type, space, etc.
3. support for attachments and other elements.

Examples classifications:
Public:  Information that is available to the general public and/or is created with the intention for broad distribution outside the company.  This information may be freely disseminated inside and outside the company without exposing the company, its customers or employees to financial loss or embarrassment, or jeopardizing the security of the company’s assets.
 
Internal:  Information belonging to the company that is created in the normal course of business with the intention of broad, general distribution within (but not outside) the company.  The disclosure, alteration or destruction of such information would create minimal risk of harm to the company, its customers or employees.  Information classified as Internal should not be shared publicly or outside the company, unless there is a legitimate business need.
 
Confidential:  Information that is sensitive to the company or a third party, such as a customer, and that should only be shared with individuals on a “need to know” basis, meaning that an individual needs access to the information to perform his or her assigned job functions.  Improper loss, corruption or disclosure of the information could significantly harm or adversely impact the company, its customers or employees or could result in a breach of our legal obligations. 
 
Highly Sensitive:  Information where the unauthorized internal or external access to, alteration or inappropriate destruction of, the information could have a catastrophic impact to the company, its customers or employees.  For this information, data integrity is extremely vital and the highest possible levels of confidentiality, restricted access and security measures are essential.
fields.summary: Support Data Classification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30052].
  {panel}

The new sidebar consumes a considerable amount of screen real-estate in a very key visual location, and contains features that most of our users simply won't ever require.

In our current 5.1.4 test deployment, our landing wiki page has the following elements in a standard user's sidebar:

- A large logo + header text
- "Space tools"
- "Page map" (there are no subpages on the landing page, so this is empty)

This leads to visually wasted space and user confusion; the intended content is on our wiki page, not the sidebar.

The space admin is worse off, with a whole paragraph of text in what is ostensibly a navigation bar:

{quote}
Here you can add shortcut links to the most important content for your team or project. Configure sidebar.
{quote}

At the very least, an option to have the sidebar collapsed by default would be preferable to the current design. Users can't figure out that the sidebar is collapsable, and by the time they do, we've already wasted their visual and attention currency on information/navigation that isn't relevant to them.
fields.summary: Disable sidebar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30050].
{panel}
{panel:title=Update from Atlassian|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
This issue has been resolved in Confluence 5.9.8.

The fix we implemented is in the front end, and stops duplicate user records from displaying anywhere in Confluence - in the People Directory, Shares, or Mentions. The underlying duplicates may still exist in the database, and new duplicates may be created, however these are harmless and can be safely ignored. As of Confluence 5.9.8, you should no longer see duplicate users in People Directory, shares, mentions in Confluence. For duplicated users displayed in the search result, refer to CONFSERVER-56554
{panel}
h3. Symptoms
 * Users appear twice in the People Directory, in shares, and mentions
 * Users have two USERINFO records with no 'prevver' value (ie two current records), eg:
{code:java}
select * from content where contenttype like 'USERINFO' and prevver is null;
{code}
(i) USERINFO records that do *not* have an entry in prevver are the currently active records. This is a little counter-intuitive given the name of the field, however older records that are no longer active contain the id of the superseding record in prevver. If prevver is null, the record is considered active.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

This may not be the only way to have this happen, but doing the following sequence will cause this to happen:
 # Create a user in an LDAP server, which you want to test with
 # Set up the LDAP server in Confluence
 # Synchronise
 # Log in as that user and possibly add some extra profile information such as a picture/description
 # Disable the LDAP directory
 # Rename that user in the LDAP server
 # Create a new LDAP directory exactly the same
 # Synchronise

h3. Known Triggers

This has been confirmed to occur on upgrade to 5.1.3, and possibly earlier or later versions.
h3. Case Study
 * These 3 users were duplicated as part of the upgrade to 5.1.3 (some irrelevant columns have been removed for ease of reading):
||contentid||contenttype||version||creator||creationdate||lastmodifier||lastmoddate||prevver||content_status||username||
|22217497|USERINFO|1|an.admin|10/05/2013|an.admin|10/05/2013| |current|USER1|
|24248321|USERINFO|1| |7/06/2013| |7/06/2013| |current|user1|
|917505|USERINFO|3|admin|12/03/2012|user2|14/12/2012| |current|user2|
|24248322|USERINFO|1| |7/06/2013| |7/06/2013| |current|USER2|
|1409789|USERINFO|1|USER3|29/03/2012|USER3|29/03/2012| |current|USER3|
|24248323|USERINFO|1| |7/06/2013| |7/06/2013| |current|user3|

NB: Note the casing above - the 1st and 3rd records were originally uppercase, the second was originally lowercase.
 * All 3 duplicates were created on June 7th. This was in the logs:
{code:java}
2013-06-07 19:40:39,244 INFO [main] [confluence.upgrade.upgradetask.UserIndexingUpgradeTask] doUpgrade Found 3 usernames that need PersonalInformation created.
{code}

 * I originally suspected that the casing of the usernames may have changed, but the users are currently in the original casing in cwd_user (upperfor USER1 and USER3, and lower for user2).

 * There was a warning regarding a case change for user2, going back as far as October 2012 (found in old support case) :
{code:java}
2013-06-10 09:22:11,856 WARN [http-8080-40] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DelegatedAuthenticationDirectory] updateLdapUser remote username [ USER2 ] casing differs from local username [ user2 ]. User details will be kept updated, but the username cannot be updated
{code}

 * All 3 users are LDAP user accounts. This is a Delegated Authentication directory, and not a synchronising Connector type.

h3. Diagnosis - is this affecting you?

First, try a content reindex. If this doesn't help, run this query (on any version). If it returns any results, this bug is the cause of your duplicates.
{code:java}
SELECT c.username
      FROM CONTENT c
      WHERE
        contenttype LIKE 'USERINFO'
        AND prevver is null
          GROUP BY c.username
          HAVING count(c.username)>1;
{code}
If this query returns nothing, have a look at CONF-36018 as well.
h3. Work Around
 # Stop Confluence
 # Make a [full database and file system backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Production+Backup+Strategy]
 # Run this command to find the usernames of affected users - ensure these match what you are seeing in the People Directory before deleting
{code:java}
// FOR CONFLUENCE 5.3 AND ABOVE
SELECT m.username FROM content c
 JOIN user_mapping m ON c.username = m.user_key
  WHERE c.username IN
    (SELECT c.username
      FROM CONTENT c
      WHERE
        contenttype LIKE 'USERINFO'
        AND prevver is null
          GROUP BY c.username
          HAVING count(c.username)>1)
    GROUP BY m.username;

// FOR CONFLUENCE 5.2 AND BELOW
SELECT c.username FROM CONTENT c
  WHERE c.username IN
    (SELECT c.username
      FROM CONTENT c
      WHERE
        contenttype LIKE 'USERINFO'
        AND prevver is null
          GROUP BY c.username
          HAVING count(c.username)>1)
    GROUP BY c.username;
{code}

 # Run this command to delete the duplicate entries (all versions). The row with the higher {{contentid}} will be deleted.
{code:sql}
DELETE FROM CONTENT
WHERE prevver IN
    (SELECT DISTINCT c1.contentid AS "pageid"
     FROM CONTENT c1
     JOIN CONTENT c2 ON c1.username = c2.username
     WHERE c1.contenttype = 'USERINFO'
     AND c2.contenttype = 'USERINFO'
     AND c1.prevver is null 
     AND c2.prevver is null 
     AND c1.contentid > c2.contentid);

DELETE FROM CONTENT
WHERE contentid IN
    (SELECT DISTINCT c1.contentid AS "pageid"
     FROM CONTENT c1
     JOIN CONTENT c2 ON c1.username = c2.username
     WHERE c1.contenttype = 'USERINFO'
     AND c2.contenttype = 'USERINFO'
     AND c1.prevver is null 
     AND c2.prevver is null 
     AND c1.contentid > c2.contentid);{code}

 # Restart Confluence.
 # If you are still experiencing problems, have a look at CONF-36018 as well.

NB: If you have any trouble running the delete query because of foreign key constraints on the ATTACHMENT or CONTENT tables, do not remove the entries from that table. Instead, please get in touch with Support and we can help you remove the duplicates, and update the queries to be more robust.
fields.summary: Users are duplicated in the People Directory, shares, mentions, and have two USERINFO records in the database

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30040].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Cancel adding groups(s) or user(s) in Global or Space Permissions is not working as expected.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to !https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/files/747833194/747833195/2/1517274813281/cog.png! > General configuration > Global Permissions
 # Click 'Edit Permissions'
 # Add user(s)/group(s)
 # Say you changed your mind and click 'Cancel' instead of saving the added user(s)/group(s)

(i) This also applies to *Space Permissions*. Please see below screen shots for further visualisation of the issue.
h3. Expected Results

All changes would be ignored and the users and/or groups would not be added.
h3. Actual Results

The user and/or groups is added anyways.
h3. Workaround

Manually remove the added group or user by un-checking the single checked option for the newly added user/group and saving the change.
fields.summary: Cancel adding groups(s)/user(s) in Global/Space Permissions is not working

Hello,

I'm raising this feature request to you as recently I've been running into the following problem.
We have a Confluence Page (Mother Page) where we have been adding files (attachments) since June on a daily basis and now the number is so high, that we would like to archive them/move them to a different Confluence Page (Child Page).
There is the solution to have all the attachments downloaded from the Mother Page, removed and then uploaded to the Child Page, but this will lead to the loose of the Creator, Creation Date and Comment sections for every attachment, which we wouldn't like to have it lost.

Could you please let me know if these is something similar to what I request, already in place or by when this requested feature will be implemented?


Thank you,
Cristian
fields.summary: Move attachments from one Confluence Page (Mother Page) to another Confluence Page (Child Page).

It would be nice to be able to hide text on a page and have it only be visible when editing the page. Right now, I would have to use the excerpt macro to do this, and doing so shows the first header of this content as the excerpt when referenced. 

I would like to be able to, for example, add a Key or Legend to a page, like a table of labels and their uses, or a table of status widgets for users to copy and paste from when filling out a form. However, I don't want these visible on the page when viewing it.

If there is a feature that I have overlooked (not the page properties macro or the excerpt macro), then please let me know.

fields.description:
There is a leading space created in the blank cells in a page properties macro. This poses a problem with templates that feature the page properties macro. Even if I delete the spaces in the template, when you go to create a page from the template, the spaces are recreated. In addition to display issues with irregular columns, this poses issues for users exporting the tables and then having to remove the leading space in Excel before working with the data.

The work-around I've been using until now has been to put filler characters into the cells. For example:

|Status|___|
|Date|___|
|Summary|___|

That prevents the macro from creating the leading space (since it only happens when the cell is blank); this way, when my users go to add values to those fields they replace the underscores. Otherwise, when you click on the blank cell, the default position for your cursor is AFTER the leading space. Some users notice the space and delete it, most don't.

The big problem comes with the excerpt macro. I have taken to putting the excerpt macro into the blank summary field in these templates, so that the summary displays as an excerpt when used in the Child Display macro with excerpts enabled, if a user wants to add a summary. However, for obvious reasons, I can't use the three underscores trick, since that's what will display as the excerpt. If I remove them, then the single leading space displays. Attached screenshot displays both variations.

As a result, I cannot use the excerpt macro within a page properties macro in a template.
fields.summary: Page Properties Macro Inserts Leading Space in Blank Table Cells

fields.description:
If you move a page with children into a new space, all of the links in the children break because they retain an absolute reference to the old space key.

Setup:

# Create a Parent Page.
# Create a Child Page.
# Create a link on the Child Page to the Parent Page (using \[ shortcut and autocomplete).
# Create a link on the Parent Page to the Child Page.
# Move the Parent Page to a new space.

At this point, the link from Parent to Child works, but Child to Parent breaks.  I tested with all sorts of nested setups, and for all cases, any page under Parent Page end up with broken links.  This includes the link from Child Page to it's child, Child Page 2.  Only the top Parent kept its relative links after the move.  The rest became absolute and pointed to the wrong space.
fields.summary: Moving page hierarchies between spaces breaks relative page links in children

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-30004].
  {panel}

If you indent a table, upon export to PDF, the table is left-justified.  It does not retain indentation. 

Often you want to indent or center tables to create customer-facing documentation that is easier to read or you may want to insert a table to appear next to an image for clarity.  Similar to how you might also indent a sentence or paragraph for calling out information or providing focus on it. 

However, currently, when you attempt to format the information as such, on export, everything is left-justified. 
The table should still be formatted to fit the width of the page; except the left-justification should be based on where the editor has determined it wants the table to be initiated.

(Initial request logged through support, AOD-40521)
fields.summary: PDF Export should render table indentations as designed when rendered in the UI

fields.description:
h3. Symptoms 
Rendering a large xls or xlsx spreadsheet can cause an OutOfMemory error in Confluence. We have seen this occur on OnDemand instances and behind-the-firewall instances.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Developers, please see the attachment PLM_stats.xls in [this (private) support case|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-103978] for an example of a file that can cause this issue.

h3. Workarounds
# Reduce the size of the spreadsheet to reduce the rendering required
# [Increase the memory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Fix+Out+of+Memory+Errors+by+Increasing+Available+Memory] available to Confluence
# NB: If you use G1GC we would recommend turning that off. We have not done extensive testing but the collector it replaced (CMS) did not generally perform well with Confluence, and we have anecdotally seen some examples of G1GC causing problems with Confluence as well.
fields.summary: Rendering a large spreadsheet can cause OutOfMemory errors
